dynamicProperty.name: sql.args.N.format
dynamicProperty.value: SQL format argument to be supplied
dynamicProperty.description: This attribute is always optional, but default options may not always work for your data. Incoming FlowFiles are expected to be parametrized SQL statements. In some cases a format option needs to be specified, currently this is only applicable for binary data types, dates, times and timestamps. Binary Data Types (defaults to 'ascii') - ascii: each string character in your attribute value represents a single byte. This is the format provided by Avro Processors. base64: the string is a Base64 encoded string that can be decoded to bytes. hex: the string is hex encoded with all letters in upper case and no '0x' at the beginning. Dates/Times/Timestamps - Date, Time and Timestamp formats all support both custom formats or named format ('yyyy-MM-dd','ISO_OFFSET_DATE_TIME') as specified according to java.time.format.DateTimeFormatter. If not specified, a long value input is expected to be an unix epoch (milli seconds from 1970/1/1), or a string value in 'yyyy-MM-dd' format for Date, 'HH:mm:ss.SSS' for Time (some database engines e.g. Derby or MySQL do not support milliseconds and will truncate milliseconds), 'yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm:ss.SSS' for Timestamp is used.

relationship.name: success
relationship.description: Successfully created FlowFile from SQL query result set.

relationship.name: failure
relationship.description: SQL query execution failed. Incoming FlowFile will be penalized and routed to this relationship

readsAttribute.name: sql.args.N.type
readsAttribute.description: Incoming FlowFiles are expected to be parametrized SQL statements. The type of each Parameter is specified as an integer that represents the JDBC Type of the parameter. The following types are accepted: [LONGNVARCHAR: -16], [BIT: -7], [BOOLEAN: 16], [TINYINT: -6], [BIGINT: -5], [LONGVARBINARY: -4], [VARBINARY: -3], [BINARY: -2], [LONGVARCHAR: -1], [CHAR: 1], [NUMERIC: 2], [DECIMAL: 3], [INTEGER: 4], [SMALLINT: 5] [FLOAT: 6], [REAL: 7], [DOUBLE: 8], [VARCHAR: 12], [DATE: 91], [TIME: 92], [TIMESTAMP: 93], [VARCHAR: 12], [CLOB: 2005], [NCLOB: 2011]

readsAttribute.name: sql.args.N.value
readsAttribute.description: Incoming FlowFiles are expected to be parametrized SQL statements. The value of the Parameters are specified as sql.args.1.value, sql.args.2.value, sql.args.3.value, and so on. The type of the sql.args.1.value Parameter is specified by the sql.args.1.type attribute.

readsAttribute.name: sql.args.N.format
readsAttribute.description: This attribute is always optional, but default options may not always work for your data. Incoming FlowFiles are expected to be parametrized SQL statements. In some cases a format option needs to be specified, currently this is only applicable for binary data types, dates, times and timestamps. Binary Data Types (defaults to 'ascii') - ascii: each string character in your attribute value represents a single byte. This is the format provided by Avro Processors. base64: the string is a Base64 encoded string that can be decoded to bytes. hex: the string is hex encoded with all letters in upper case and no '0x' at the beginning. Dates/Times/Timestamps - Date, Time and Timestamp formats all support both custom formats or named format ('yyyy-MM-dd','ISO_OFFSET_DATE_TIME') as specified according to java.time.format.DateTimeFormatter. If not specified, a long value input is expected to be an unix epoch (milli seconds from 1970/1/1), or a string value in 'yyyy-MM-dd' format for Date, 'HH:mm:ss.SSS' for Time (some database engines e.g. Derby or MySQL do not support milliseconds and will truncate milliseconds), 'yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm:ss.SSS' for Timestamp is used.

writesAttribute.name: executesql.row.count
writesAttribute.description: Contains the number of rows returned in the select query

writesAttribute.name: executesql.query.duration
writesAttribute.description: Combined duration of the query execution time and fetch time in milliseconds

writesAttribute.name: executesql.query.executiontime
writesAttribute.description: Duration of the query execution time in milliseconds

writesAttribute.name: executesql.query.fetchtime
writesAttribute.description: Duration of the result set fetch time in milliseconds

writesAttribute.name: executesql.resultset.index
writesAttribute.description: Assuming multiple result sets are returned, the zero based index of this result set.

writesAttribute.name: executesql.error.message
writesAttribute.description: If processing an incoming flow file causes an Exception, the Flow File is routed to failure and this attribute is set to the exception message.

writesAttribute.name: fragment.identifier
writesAttribute.description: If 'Max Rows Per Flow File' is set then all FlowFiles from the same query result set will have the same value for the fragment.identifier attribute. This can then be used to correlate the results.

writesAttribute.name: fragment.count
writesAttribute.description: If 'Max Rows Per Flow File' is set then this is the total number of FlowFiles produced by a single ResultSet. This can be used in conjunction with the fragment.identifier attribute in order to know how many FlowFiles belonged to the same incoming ResultSet. If Output Batch Size is set, then this attribute will not be populated.

writesAttribute.name: fragment.index
writesAttribute.description: If 'Max Rows Per Flow File' is set then the position of this FlowFile in the list of outgoing FlowFiles that were all derived from the same result set FlowFile. This can be used in conjunction with the fragment.identifier attribute to know which FlowFiles originated from the same query result set and in what order FlowFiles were produced

writesAttribute.name: input.flowfile.uuid
writesAttribute.description: If the processor has an incoming connection, outgoing FlowFiles will have this attribute set to the value of the input FlowFile's UUID. If there is no incoming connection, the attribute will not be added.

writesAttribute.name: mime.type
writesAttribute.description: Sets the mime.type attribute to the MIME Type specified by the Record Writer.

writesAttribute.name: record.count
writesAttribute.description: The number of records output by the Record Writer.

extension.name: org.apache.nifi.processors.standard.ExecuteStreamCommand
extension.description: The ExecuteStreamCommand processor provides a flexible way to integrate external commands and scripts into NiFi data flows. ExecuteStreamCommand can pass the incoming FlowFile's content to the command that it executes similarly how piping works.

property.name: Working Directory
property.description: The directory to use as the current working directory when executing the command

property.name: Command Path
property.description: Specifies the command to be executed; if just the name of an executable is provided, it must be in the user's environment PATH.

property.name: argumentsStrategy
property.description: Strategy for configuring arguments to be supplied to the command.

allowableValue.description: Arguments to be supplied to the executable are taken from the Command Arguments property
Arguments to be supplied to the executable are taken from dynamic properties with pattern of 'command.argument.<commandIndex>'

property.name: Command Arguments
property.description: The arguments to supply to the executable delimited by the ';' character.

property.name: Argument Delimiter
property.description: Delimiter to use to separate arguments for a command [default: ;]. Must be a single character

property.name: Ignore STDIN
property.description: If true, the contents of the incoming flowfile will not be passed to the executing command

property.name: Output Destination Attribute
property.description: If set, the output of the stream command will be put into an attribute of the original FlowFile instead of a separate FlowFile. There will no longer be a relationship for 'output stream' or 'nonzero status'. The value of this property will be the key for the output attribute.

property.name: Max Attribute Length
property.description: If routing the output of the stream command to an attribute, the number of characters put to the attribute value will be at most this amount. This is important because attributes are held in memory and large attributes will quickly cause out of memory issues. If the output goes longer than this value, it will truncated to fit. Consider making this smaller if able.

property.name: Output MIME Type
property.description: Specifies the value to set for the "mime.type" attribute. This property is ignored if 'Output Destination Attribute' is set.

dynamicProperty.name: An environment variable name
dynamicProperty.description: These environment variables are passed to the process spawned by this Processor

dynamicProperty.name: command.argument.<commandIndex>
dynamicProperty.value: Argument to be supplied to the command
dynamicProperty.description: These arguments are supplied to the process spawned by this Processor when using the Command Arguments Strategy : Dynamic Property Arguments. <commandIndex> is a number and it will determine the order.

relationship.name: output stream
relationship.description: The destination path for the flow file created from the command's output, if the returned status code is zero.

relationship.name: nonzero status
relationship.description: The destination path for the flow file created from the command's output, if the returned status code is non-zero. All flow files routed to this relationship will be penalized.

relationship.name: original
relationship.description: The original FlowFile will be routed. It will have new attributes detailing the result of the script execution.

writesAttribute.name: execution.command
writesAttribute.description: The name of the command executed

writesAttribute.name: execution.command.args
writesAttribute.description: The semi-colon delimited list of arguments. Sensitive properties will be masked

writesAttribute.name: execution.status
writesAttribute.description: The exit status code returned from executing the command

writesAttribute.name: execution.error
writesAttribute.description: Any error messages returned from executing the command

writesAttribute.name: mime.type
writesAttribute.description: Sets the MIME type of the output if the 'Output MIME Type' property is set and 'Output Destination Attribute' is not set

restriction.explanation: Provides operator the ability to execute arbitrary code assuming all permissions that NiFi has.

extension.name: org.apache.nifi.processors.standard.ExtractGrok
extension.description: Evaluates one or more Grok Expressions against the content of a FlowFile, adding the results as attributes or replacing the content of the FlowFile with a JSON notation of the matched content

property.name: Grok Expression
property.description: Grok expression. If other Grok expressions are referenced in this expression, they must be provided in the Grok Pattern File if set or exist in the default Grok patterns

property.name: Grok Pattern file
property.description: Custom Grok pattern definitions. These definitions will be loaded after the default Grok patterns. The Grok Parser will use the default Grok patterns when this property is not configured.

property.name: Destination
property.description: Control if Grok output value is written as a new flowfile attributes, in this case each of the Grok identifier that is matched in the flowfile will be added as an attribute, prefixed with "grok." or written in the flowfile content. Writing to flowfile content will overwrite any existing flowfile content.

property.name: Character Set
property.description: The Character Set in which the file is encoded

property.name: Maximum Buffer Size
property.description: Specifies the maximum amount of data to buffer (per file) in order to apply the Grok expressions. Files larger than the specified maximum will not be fully evaluated.

property.name: Named captures only
property.description: Only store named captures from grok

property.name: Keep Empty Captures
property.description: If true, then empty capture values will be included in the returned capture map.

relationship.name: unmatched
relationship.description: FlowFiles are routed to this relationship when no provided Grok Expression matches the content of the FlowFile

relationship.name: matched
relationship.description: FlowFiles are routed to this relationship when the Grok Expression is successfully evaluated and the FlowFile is modified as a result

writesAttribute.name: grok.XXX
writesAttribute.description: When operating in flowfile-attribute mode, each of the Grok identifier that is matched in the flowfile will be added as an attribute, prefixed with "grok." For example,if the grok identifier "timestamp" is matched, then the value will be added to an attribute named "grok.timestamp"

restriction.explanation: Patterns can reference resources over HTTP

extension.name: org.apache.nifi.processors.standard.ExtractRecordSchema
extension.description: Extracts the record schema from the FlowFile using the supplied Record Reader and writes it to the `avro.schema` attribute.

property.name: record-reader
property.description: Specifies the Controller Service to use for reading incoming data

property.name: cache-size
property.description: Specifies the number of schemas to cache. This value should reflect the expected number of different schemas that may be in the incoming FlowFiles. This ensures more efficient retrieval of the schemas and thus the processor performance.

relationship.name: success
relationship.description: FlowFiles whose record schemas are successfully extracted will be routed to this relationship

relationship.name: failure
relationship.description: If a FlowFile's record schema cannot be extracted from the configured input format, the FlowFile will be routed to this relationship

writesAttribute.name: record.error.message
writesAttribute.description: This attribute provides on failure the error message encountered by the Reader.

writesAttribute.name: avro.schema
writesAttribute.description: This attribute provides the schema extracted from the input FlowFile using the provided RecordReader.

extension.name: org.apache.nifi.processors.standard.ExtractText
extension.description: Evaluates one or more Regular Expressions against the content of a FlowFile. The results of those Regular Expressions are assigned to FlowFile Attributes. Regular Expressions are entered by adding user-defined properties; the name of the property maps to the Attribute Name into which the result will be placed. The attributes are generated differently based on the enabling of named capture groups. If named capture groups are not enabled: The first capture group, if any found, will be placed into that attribute name.But all capture groups, including the matching string sequence itself will also be provided at that attribute name with an index value provided, with the exception of a capturing group that is optional and does not match - for example, given the attribute name "regex" and expression "abc(def)?(g)" we would add an attribute "regex.1" with a value of "def" if the "def" matched. If the "def" did not match, no attribute named "regex.1" would be added but an attribute named "regex.2" with a value of "g" will be added regardless.If named capture groups are enabled: Each named capture group, if found will be placed into the attributes name with the name provided. If enabled the matching string sequence itself will be placed into the attribute name. If multiple matches are enabled, and index will be applied after the first set of matches. The exception is a capturing group that is optional and does not match For example, given the attribute name "regex" and expression "abc(?<NAMED>def)?(?<NAMED-TWO>g)" we would add an attribute "regex.NAMED" with the value of "def" if the "def" matched. We would add an attribute "regex.NAMED-TWO" with the value of "g" if the "g" matched regardless. The value of the property must be a valid Regular Expressions with one or more capturing groups. If named capture groups are enabled, all capture groups must be named. If they are not, then the processor configuration will fail validation. If the Regular Expression matches more than once, only the first match will be used unless the property enabling repeating capture group is set to true. If any provided Regular Expression matches, the FlowFile(s) will be routed to 'matched'. If no provided Regular Expression matches, the FlowFile will be routed to 'unmatched' and no attributes will be applied to the FlowFile.

property.name: Character Set
property.description: The Character Set in which the file is encoded

property.name: Maximum Buffer Size
property.description: Specifies the maximum amount of data to buffer (per FlowFile) in order to apply the regular expressions. FlowFiles larger than the specified maximum will not be fully evaluated.

property.name: Maximum Capture Group Length
property.description: Specifies the maximum number of characters a given capture group value can have. Any characters beyond the max will be truncated.

property.name: Enable Canonical Equivalence
property.description: Indicates that two characters match only when their full canonical decompositions match.

property.name: Enable Case-insensitive Matching
property.description: Indicates that two characters match even if they are in a different case. Can also be specified via the embedded flag (?i).

property.name: Permit Whitespace and Comments in Pattern
property.displayName: Permit Whitespace and Comments in Pattern
property.description: In this mode, whitespace is ignored, and embedded comments starting with # are ignored until the end of a line. Can also be specified via the embedded flag (?x).

property.name: Enable DOTALL Mode
property.description: Indicates that the expression '.' should match any character, including a line terminator. Can also be specified via the embedded flag (?s).

property.name: Enable Literal Parsing of the Pattern
property.displayName: Enable Literal Parsing of the Pattern
property.description: Indicates that Metacharacters and escape characters should be given no special meaning.

property.name: Enable Multiline Mode
property.description: Indicates that '^' and '$' should match just after and just before a line terminator or end of sequence, instead of only the beginning or end of the entire input. Can also be specified via the embeded flag (?m).

property.name: Enable Unicode-aware Case Folding
property.description: When used with 'Enable Case-insensitive Matching', matches in a manner consistent with the Unicode Standard. Can also be specified via the embedded flag (?u).

property.name: Enable Unicode Predefined Character Classes
property.description: Specifies conformance with the Unicode Technical Standard #18: Unicode Regular Expression Annex C: Compatibility Properties. Can also be specified via the embedded flag (?U).

property.name: Enable Unix Lines Mode
property.description: Indicates that only the ' ' line terminator is recognized in the behavior of '.', '^', and '$'. Can also be specified via the embedded flag (?d).

property.name: Include Capture Group 0
property.description: Indicates that Capture Group 0 should be included as an attribute. Capture Group 0 represents the entirety of the regular expression match, is typically not used, and could have considerable length.

property.name: Enable repeating capture group
property.description: If set to true, every string matching the capture groups will be extracted. Otherwise, if the Regular Expression matches more than once, only the first match will be extracted.

property.name: Enable named group support
property.description: If set to true, when named groups are present in the regular expression, the name of the group will be used in the attribute name as opposed to the group index. All capturing groups must be named, if the number of groups (not including capture group 0) does not equal the number of named groups validation will fail.

dynamicProperty.name: A FlowFile attribute
dynamicProperty.value: A Regular Expression with one or more capturing group
dynamicProperty.description: The first capture group, if any found, will be placed into that attribute name.But all capture groups, including the matching string sequence itself will also be provided at that attribute name with an index value provided.

relationship.name: matched
relationship.description: FlowFiles are routed to this relationship when the Regular Expression is successfully evaluated and the FlowFile is modified as a result

relationship.name: unmatched
relationship.description: FlowFiles are routed to this relationship when no provided Regular Expression matches the content of the FlowFile

extension.name: org.apache.nifi.processors.standard.FetchDistributedMapCache
extension.description: Computes cache key(s) from FlowFile attributes, for each incoming FlowFile, and fetches the value(s) from the Distributed Map Cache associated with each key. If configured without a destination attribute, the incoming FlowFile's content is replaced with the binary data received by the Distributed Map Cache. If there is no value stored under that key then the flow file will be routed to 'not-found'. Note that the processor will always attempt to read the entire cached value into memory before placing it in it's destination. This could be potentially problematic if the cached value is very large.

property.name: Cache Entry Identifier
property.description: A comma-delimited list of FlowFile attributes, or the results of Attribute Expression Language statements, which will be evaluated against a FlowFile in order to determine the value(s) used to identify duplicates; it is these values that are cached. NOTE: Only a single Cache Entry Identifier is allowed unless Put Cache Value In Attribute is specified. Multiple cache lookups are only supported when the destination is a set of attributes (see the documentation for 'Put Cache Value In Attribute' for more details including naming convention.

property.name: Distributed Cache Service
property.description: The Controller Service that is used to get the cached values.

property.name: Put Cache Value In Attribute
property.description: If set, the cache value received will be put into an attribute of the FlowFile instead of a the content of theFlowFile. The attribute key to put to is determined by evaluating value of this property. If multiple Cache Entry Identifiers are selected, multiple attributes will be written, using the evaluated value of this property, appended by a period (.) and the name of the cache entry identifier.

property.name: Max Length To Put In Attribute
property.displayName: Max Length To Put In Attribute
property.description: If routing the cache value to an attribute of the FlowFile (by setting the "Put Cache Value in attribute" property), the number of characters put to the attribute value will be at most this amount. This is important because attributes are held in memory and large attributes will quickly cause out of memory issues. If the output goes longer than this value, it will be truncated to fit. Consider making this smaller if able.

property.name: Character Set
property.description: The Character Set in which the cached value is encoded. This will only be used when routing to an attribute.

relationship.name: success
relationship.description: If the cache was successfully communicated with it will be routed to this relationship

relationship.name: failure
relationship.description: If unable to communicate with the cache or if the cache entry is evaluated to be blank, the FlowFile will be penalized and routed to this relationship

relationship.name: not-found
relationship.description: If a FlowFile's Cache Entry Identifier was not found in the cache, it will be routed to this relationship

writesAttribute.name: user-defined
writesAttribute.description: If the 'Put Cache Value In Attribute' property is set then whatever it is set to will become the attribute key and the value would be whatever the response was from the Distributed Map Cache. If multiple cache entry identifiers are selected, multiple attributes will be written, using the evaluated value of this property, appended by a period (.) and the name of the cache entry identifier. For example, if the Cache Entry Identifier property is set to 'id,name', and the user-defined property is named 'fetched', then two attributes will be written, fetched.id and fetched.name, containing their respective values.

extension.name: org.apache.nifi.processors.standard.FetchFTP
extension.description: Fetches the content of a file from a remote FTP server and overwrites the contents of an incoming FlowFile with the content of the remote file.

property.name: Hostname
property.description: The fully-qualified hostname or IP address of the host to fetch the data from

property.name: Port
property.description: The port to connect to on the remote host to fetch the data from

property.name: Username
property.description: Username

property.name: Password
property.description: Password for the user account

property.name: Remote File
property.description: The fully qualified filename on the remote system

property.name: Completion Strategy
property.description: Specifies what to do with the original file on the server once it has been pulled into NiFi. If the Completion Strategy fails, a warning will be logged but the data will still be transferred.

allowableValue.description: Leave the file as-is
Move the file to the directory specified by the <Move Destination Directory> property
Deletes the original file from the remote system

property.name: Move Destination Directory
property.description: The directory on the remote server to move the original file to once it has been ingested into NiFi. This property is ignored unless the Completion Strategy is set to 'Move File'. The specified directory must already exist on the remote system if 'Create Directory' is disabled, or the rename will fail.

property.name: Create Directory
property.description: Used when 'Completion Strategy' is 'Move File'. Specifies whether or not the remote directory should be created if it does not exist.

property.name: Connection Timeout
property.description: Amount of time to wait before timing out while creating a connection

property.name: Data Timeout
property.description: When transferring a file between the local and remote system, this value specifies how long is allowed to elapse without any data being transferred between systems

property.name: Use Compression
property.description: Indicates whether or not ZLIB compression should be used when transferring files

property.name: Connection Mode
property.description: The FTP Connection Mode

property.name: Transfer Mode
property.description: The FTP Transfer Mode

property.name: proxy-configuration-service
property.description: Specifies the Proxy Configuration Controller Service to proxy network requests. If set, it supersedes proxy settings configured per component. Supported proxies: HTTP + AuthN, SOCKS + AuthN

property.name: Proxy Type
property.description: Proxy type used for file transfers

property.name: Proxy Host
property.description: The fully qualified hostname or IP address of the proxy server

property.name: Proxy Port
property.description: The port of the proxy server

property.name: Http Proxy Username
property.description: Http Proxy Username

property.name: Http Proxy Password
property.description: Http Proxy Password

property.name: Internal Buffer Size
property.description: Set the internal buffer size for buffered data streams

property.name: fetchfiletransfer-notfound-loglevel
property.displayName: Log level when file not found
property.description: Log level to use in case the file does not exist when the processor is triggered

property.name: ftp-use-utf8
property.description: Tells the client to use UTF-8 encoding when processing files and filenames. If set to true, the server must also support UTF-8 encoding.

relationship.name: success
relationship.description: All FlowFiles that are received are routed to success

relationship.name: comms.failure
relationship.description: Any FlowFile that could not be fetched from the remote server due to a communications failure will be transferred to this Relationship.

relationship.name: not.found
relationship.description: Any FlowFile for which we receive a 'Not Found' message from the remote server will be transferred to this Relationship.

relationship.name: permission.denied
relationship.description: Any FlowFile that could not be fetched from the remote server due to insufficient permissions will be transferred to this Relationship.

writesAttribute.name: ftp.remote.host
writesAttribute.description: The hostname or IP address from which the file was pulled

writesAttribute.name: ftp.remote.port
writesAttribute.description: The port that was used to communicate with the remote FTP server

writesAttribute.name: ftp.remote.filename
writesAttribute.description: The name of the remote file that was pulled

writesAttribute.name: filename
writesAttribute.description: The filename is updated to point to the filename fo the remote file

writesAttribute.name: path
writesAttribute.description: If the Remote File contains a directory name, that directory name will be added to the FlowFile using the 'path' attribute

multiProcessorUseCase.description: Retrieve all files in a directory of an FTP Server

processorConfiguration.configuration:
The "Hostname" property should be set to the fully qualified hostname of the FTP Server. It's a good idea to parameterize this property by setting it to something like `#{FTP_SERVER}`. The "Remote Path" property must be set to the directory on the FTP Server where the files reside. If the flow being built is to be reused elsewhere, it's a good idea to parameterize this property by setting it to something like `#{FTP_REMOTE_PATH}`. Configure the "Username" property to the appropriate username for logging into the FTP Server. It's usually a good idea to parameterize this property by setting it to something like `#{FTP_USERNAME}`. Configure the "Password" property to the appropriate password for the provided username. It's usually a good idea to parameterize this property by setting it to something like `#{FTP_PASSWORD}`.
The 'success' Relationship of this Processor is then connected to FetchFTP.

extension.name: org.apache.nifi.processors.standard.FetchFile
extension.description: Reads the contents of a file from disk and streams it into the contents of an incoming FlowFile. Once this is done, the file is optionally moved elsewhere or deleted to help keep the file system organized.

property.name: File to Fetch
property.description: The fully-qualified filename of the file to fetch from the file system

property.name: Completion Strategy
property.description: Specifies what to do with the original file on the file system once it has been pulled into NiFi

allowableValue.description: Leave the file as-is
Moves the file to the directory specified by the <Move Destination Directory> property
Deletes the original file from the file system

property.name: Move Destination Directory
property.description: The directory to the move the original file to once it has been fetched from the file system. This property is ignored unless the Completion Strategy is set to "Move File". If the directory does not exist, it will be created.

property.name: Move Conflict Strategy
property.description: If Completion Strategy is set to Move File and a file already exists in the destination directory with the same name, this property specifies how that naming conflict should be resolved

allowableValue.description: The existing destination file should remain intact. The newly ingested file should be moved to the destination directory but be renamed to a random filename
The newly ingested file should replace the existing file in the Destination Directory
The existing file should in the Destination Directory should stay intact and the newly ingested file should be deleted
The existing destination file should remain intact and the incoming FlowFile should be routed to failure

property.name: Log level when file not found
property.displayName: Log level when file not found
property.description: Log level to use in case the file does not exist when the processor is triggered

property.name: Log level when permission denied
property.description: Log level to use in case user johnb does not have sufficient permissions to read the file

relationship.name: success
relationship.description: Any FlowFile that is successfully fetched from the file system will be transferred to this Relationship.

relationship.name: not.found
relationship.description: Any FlowFile that could not be fetched from the file system because the file could not be found will be transferred to this Relationship.

relationship.name: permission.denied
relationship.description: Any FlowFile that could not be fetched from the file system due to the user running NiFi not having sufficient permissions will be transferred to this Relationship.

relationship.name: failure
relationship.description: Any FlowFile that could not be fetched from the file system for any reason other than insufficient permissions or the file not existing will be transferred to this Relationship.

restriction.explanation: Provides operator the ability to read from any file that NiFi has access to.
Provides operator the ability to delete any file that NiFi has access to.

extension.name: org.apache.nifi.processors.standard.FetchSFTP
extension.description: Fetches the content of a file from a remote SFTP server and overwrites the contents of an incoming FlowFile with the content of the remote file.

property.name: Hostname
property.description: The fully-qualified hostname or IP address of the host to fetch the data from

property.name: Port
property.description: The port to connect to on the remote host to fetch the data from

property.name: Username
property.description: Username

property.name: Password
property.description: Password for the user account

property.name: Private Key Path
property.description: The fully qualified path to the Private Key file

property.name: Private Key Passphrase
property.description: Password for the private key

property.name: Remote File
property.description: The fully qualified filename on the remote system

property.name: Completion Strategy
property.description: Specifies what to do with the original file on the server once it has been pulled into NiFi. If the Completion Strategy fails, a warning will be logged but the data will still be transferred.

allowableValue.description: Leave the file as-is
Move the file to the directory specified by the <Move Destination Directory> property
Deletes the original file from the remote system

property.name: Move Destination Directory
property.description: The directory on the remote server to move the original file to once it has been ingested into NiFi. This property is ignored unless the Completion Strategy is set to 'Move File'. The specified directory must already exist on the remote system if 'Create Directory' is disabled, or the rename will fail.

property.name: Create Directory
property.description: Used when 'Completion Strategy' is 'Move File'. Specifies whether or not the remote directory should be created if it does not exist.

property.name: Disable Directory Listing
property.description: Control how 'Move Destination Directory' is created when 'Completion Strategy' is 'Move File' and 'Create Directory' is enabled. If set to 'true', directory listing is not performed prior to create missing directories. By default, this processor executes a directory listing command to see target directory existence before creating missing directories. However, there are situations that you might need to disable the directory listing such as the following. Directory listing might fail with some permission setups (e.g. chmod 100) on a directory. Also, if any other SFTP client created the directory after this processor performed a listing and before a directory creation request by this processor is finished, then an error is returned because the directory already exists.

property.name: Connection Timeout
property.description: Amount of time to wait before timing out while creating a connection

property.name: Data Timeout
property.description: When transferring a file between the local and remote system, this value specifies how long is allowed to elapse without any data being transferred between systems

property.name: Send Keep Alive On Timeout
property.description: Send a Keep Alive message every 5 seconds up to 5 times for an overall timeout of 25 seconds.

property.name: Host Key File
property.description: If supplied, the given file will be used as the Host Key; otherwise, if 'Strict Host Key Checking' property is applied (set to true) then uses the 'known_hosts' and 'known_hosts2' files from ~/.ssh directory else no host key file will be used

property.name: Strict Host Key Checking
property.description: Indicates whether or not strict enforcement of hosts keys should be applied

property.name: Use Compression
property.description: Indicates whether or not ZLIB compression should be used when transferring files

property.name: proxy-configuration-service
property.description: Specifies the Proxy Configuration Controller Service to proxy network requests. If set, it supersedes proxy settings configured per component. Supported proxies: HTTP + AuthN, SOCKS + AuthN

property.name: Proxy Type
property.description: Proxy type used for file transfers

property.name: Proxy Host
property.description: The fully qualified hostname or IP address of the proxy server

property.name: Proxy Port
property.description: The port of the proxy server

property.name: Http Proxy Username
property.description: Http Proxy Username

property.name: Http Proxy Password
property.description: Http Proxy Password

property.name: fetchfiletransfer-notfound-loglevel
property.displayName: Log level when file not found
property.description: Log level to use in case the file does not exist when the processor is triggered

property.name: Ciphers Allowed
property.description: A comma-separated list of Ciphers allowed for SFTP connections. Leave unset to allow all. Available options are: 3des-cbc, 3des-ctr, aes128-cbc, aes128-ctr, aes128-gcm@openssh.com, aes192-cbc, aes192-ctr, aes256-cbc, aes256-ctr, aes256-gcm@openssh.com, arcfour, arcfour128, arcfour256, blowfish-cbc, blowfish-ctr, cast128-cbc, cast128-ctr, chacha20-poly1305@openssh.com, idea-cbc, idea-ctr, serpent128-cbc, serpent128-ctr, serpent192-cbc, serpent192-ctr, serpent256-cbc, serpent256-ctr, twofish-cbc, twofish128-cbc, twofish128-ctr, twofish192-cbc, twofish192-ctr, twofish256-cbc, twofish256-ctr

property.name: Key Algorithms Allowed
property.description: A comma-separated list of Key Algorithms allowed for SFTP connections. Leave unset to allow all. Available options are: ecdsa-sha2-nistp256, ecdsa-sha2-nistp256-cert-v01@openssh.com, ecdsa-sha2-nistp384, ecdsa-sha2-nistp384-cert-v01@openssh.com, ecdsa-sha2-nistp521, ecdsa-sha2-nistp521-cert-v01@openssh.com, rsa-sha2-256, rsa-sha2-512, ssh-dss, ssh-dss-cert-v01@openssh.com, ssh-ed25519, ssh-ed25519-cert-v01@openssh.com, ssh-rsa, ssh-rsa-cert-v01@openssh.com

property.name: Key Exchange Algorithms Allowed
property.description: A comma-separated list of Key Exchange Algorithms allowed for SFTP connections. Leave unset to allow all. Available options are: curve25519-sha256, curve25519-sha256@libssh.org, diffie-hellman-group-exchange-sha1, diffie-hellman-group-exchange-sha256, diffie-hellman-group1-sha1, diffie-hellman-group14-sha1, diffie-hellman-group14-sha256, diffie-hellman-group14-sha256@ssh.com, diffie-hellman-group15-sha256, diffie-hellman-group15-sha256@ssh.com, diffie-hellman-group15-sha384@ssh.com, diffie-hellman-group15-sha512, diffie-hellman-group16-sha256, diffie-hellman-group16-sha384@ssh.com, diffie-hellman-group16-sha512, diffie-hellman-group16-sha512@ssh.com, diffie-hellman-group17-sha512, diffie-hellman-group18-sha512, diffie-hellman-group18-sha512@ssh.com, ecdh-sha2-nistp256, ecdh-sha2-nistp384, ecdh-sha2-nistp521, ext-info-c

property.name: Message Authentication Codes Allowed
property.description: A comma-separated list of Message Authentication Codes allowed for SFTP connections. Leave unset to allow all. Available options are: hmac-md5, hmac-md5-96, hmac-md5-96-etm@openssh.com, hmac-md5-etm@openssh.com, hmac-ripemd160, hmac-ripemd160-96, hmac-ripemd160-etm@openssh.com, hmac-ripemd160@openssh.com, hmac-sha1, hmac-sha1-96, hmac-sha1-96@openssh.com, hmac-sha1-etm@openssh.com, hmac-sha2-256, hmac-sha2-256-etm@openssh.com, hmac-sha2-512, hmac-sha2-512-etm@openssh.com

relationship.name: success
relationship.description: All FlowFiles that are received are routed to success

relationship.name: comms.failure
relationship.description: Any FlowFile that could not be fetched from the remote server due to a communications failure will be transferred to this Relationship.

relationship.name: not.found
relationship.description: Any FlowFile for which we receive a 'Not Found' message from the remote server will be transferred to this Relationship.

relationship.name: permission.denied
relationship.description: Any FlowFile that could not be fetched from the remote server due to insufficient permissions will be transferred to this Relationship.

writesAttribute.name: sftp.remote.host
writesAttribute.description: The hostname or IP address from which the file was pulled

writesAttribute.name: sftp.remote.port
writesAttribute.description: The port that was used to communicate with the remote SFTP server

writesAttribute.name: sftp.remote.filename
writesAttribute.description: The name of the remote file that was pulled

writesAttribute.name: filename
writesAttribute.description: The filename is updated to point to the filename fo the remote file

writesAttribute.name: path
writesAttribute.description: If the Remote File contains a directory name, that directory name will be added to the FlowFile using the 'path' attribute

multiProcessorUseCase.description: Retrieve all files in a directory of an SFTP Server

processorConfiguration.configuration:
The "Hostname" property should be set to the fully qualified hostname of the FTP Server. It's a good idea to parameterize this property by setting it to something like `#{SFTP_SERVER}`. The "Remote Path" property must be set to the directory on the FTP Server where the files reside. If the flow being built is to be reused elsewhere, it's a good idea to parameterize this property by setting it to something like `#{SFTP_REMOTE_PATH}`. Configure the "Username" property to the appropriate username for logging into the FTP Server. It's usually a good idea to parameterize this property by setting it to something like `#{SFTP_USERNAME}`. Configure the "Password" property to the appropriate password for the provided username. It's usually a good idea to parameterize this property by setting it to something like `#{SFTP_PASSWORD}`.
The 'success' Relationship of this Processor is then connected to FetchSFTP.

extension.name: org.apache.nifi.processors.standard.FlattenJson
extension.description: Provides the user with the ability to take a nested JSON document and flatten it into a simple key/value pair document. The keys are combined at each level with a user-defined separator that defaults to '.'. This Processor also allows to unflatten back the flattened json. It supports four kinds of flatten mode such as normal, keep-arrays, dot notation for MongoDB query and keep-primitive-arrays. Default flatten mode is 'keep-arrays'.

property.name: flatten-json-separator
property.description: The separator character used for joining keys. Must be a JSON-legal character.

property.name: flatten-mode
property.description: Specifies how json should be flattened/unflattened

allowableValue.description: Flattens every objects into a single level json
Flattens every objects and keep arrays format
Conforms to MongoDB dot notation to update also nested documents
Flattens every objects except arrays which contain only primitive types (strings, numbers, booleans and null)

property.name: ignore-reserved-characters
property.description: If true, reserved characters in keys will be ignored

property.name: flatten-json-return-type
property.description: Specifies the desired return type of json such as flatten/unflatten

property.name: flatten-json-character-set
property.description: The Character Set in which file is encoded

property.name: flatten-json-pretty-print-json
property.description: Specifies whether or not resulted json should be pretty printed

relationship.name: success
relationship.description: Successfully flattened/unflattened files go to this relationship.

relationship.name: failure
relationship.description: Files that cannot be flattened/unflattened go to this relationship.

extension.name: org.apache.nifi.processors.standard.ForkEnrichment
extension.description: Used in conjunction with the JoinEnrichment processor, this processor is responsible for adding the attributes that are necessary for the JoinEnrichment processor to perform its function. Each incoming FlowFile will be cloned. The original FlowFile will have appropriate attributes added and then be transferred to the 'original' relationship. The clone will have appropriate attributes added and then be routed to the 'enrichment' relationship. See the documentation for the JoinEnrichment processor (and especially its Additional Details) for more information on how these Processors work together and how to perform enrichment tasks in NiFi by using these Processors.

relationship.name: enrichment
relationship.description: A clone of the incoming FlowFile will be routed to this relationship, after adding appropriate attributes.

relationship.name: original
relationship.description: The incoming FlowFile will be routed to this relationship, after adding appropriate attributes.

writesAttribute.name: enrichment.group.id
writesAttribute.description: The Group ID to use in order to correlate the 'original' FlowFile with the 'enrichment' FlowFile.

writesAttribute.name: enrichment.role
writesAttribute.description: The role to use for enrichment. This will either be ORIGINAL or ENRICHMENT.

extension.name: org.apache.nifi.processors.standard.ForkRecord
extension.description: This processor allows the user to fork a record into multiple records. The user must specify at least one Record Path, as a dynamic property, pointing to a field of type ARRAY containing RECORD objects. The processor accepts two modes: 'split' and 'extract'. In both modes, there is one record generated per element contained in the designated array. In the 'split' mode, each generated record will preserve the same schema as given in the input but the array will contain only one element. In the 'extract' mode, the element of the array must be of record type and will be the generated record. Additionally, in the 'extract' mode, it is possible to specify if each generated record should contain all the fields of the parent records from the root level to the extracted record. This assumes that the fields to add in the record are defined in the schema of the Record Writer controller service. See examples in the additional details documentation of this processor.

property.name: record-reader
property.description: Specifies the Controller Service to use for reading incoming data

property.name: record-writer
property.description: Specifies the Controller Service to use for writing out the records

property.name: fork-mode
property.description: Specifies the forking mode of the processor

allowableValue.description: Generated records will be the elements of the array
Generated records will preserve the input schema and will contain a one-element array

property.name: include-parent-fields
property.description: This parameter is only valid with the 'extract' mode. If set to true, all the fields from the root level to the given array will be added as fields of each element of the array to fork.

dynamicProperty.name: Record Path property
dynamicProperty.description: A Record Path value, pointing to a field of type ARRAY containing RECORD objects

relationship.name: failure
relationship.description: In case a FlowFile generates an error during the fork operation, it will be routed to this relationship

relationship.name: original
relationship.description: The original FlowFiles will be routed to this relationship

relationship.name: fork
relationship.description: The FlowFiles containing the forked records will be routed to this relationship

writesAttribute.name: record.count
writesAttribute.description: The generated FlowFile will have a 'record.count' attribute indicating the number of records that were written to the FlowFile.

writesAttribute.name: mime.type
writesAttribute.description: The MIME Type indicated by the Record Writer

writesAttribute.name: <Attributes from Record Writer>
writesAttribute.description: Any Attribute that the configured Record Writer returns will be added to the FlowFile.

extension.name: org.apache.nifi.processors.standard.GenerateFlowFile
extension.description: This processor creates FlowFiles with random data or custom content. GenerateFlowFile is useful for load testing, configuration, and simulation. Also see DuplicateFlowFile for additional load testing.

property.name: File Size
property.description: The size of the file that will be used

property.name: Batch Size
property.description: The number of FlowFiles to be transferred in each invocation

property.name: Data Format
property.description: Specifies whether the data should be Text or Binary

property.name: Unique FlowFiles
property.description: If true, each FlowFile that is generated will be unique. If false, a random value will be generated and all FlowFiles will get the same content but this offers much higher throughput

property.name: generate-ff-custom-text
property.description: If Data Format is text and if Unique FlowFiles is false, then this custom text will be used as content of the generated FlowFiles and the File Size will be ignored. Finally, if Expression Language is used, evaluation will be performed only once per batch of generated FlowFiles

property.name: character-set
property.description: Specifies the character set to use when writing the bytes of Custom Text to a flow file.

property.name: mime-type
property.description: Specifies the value to set for the "mime.type" attribute.

dynamicProperty.name: Generated FlowFile attribute name
dynamicProperty.description: Specifies an attribute on generated FlowFiles defined by the Dynamic Property's key and value. If Expression Language is used, evaluation will be performed only once per batch of generated FlowFiles.

writesAttribute.name: mime.type
writesAttribute.description: Sets the MIME type of the output if the 'Mime Type' property is set

extension.name: org.apache.nifi.processors.standard.GenerateRecord
extension.description: This processor creates FlowFiles with records having random value for the specified fields. GenerateRecord is useful for testing, configuration, and simulation. It uses either user-defined properties to define a record schema or a provided schema and generates the specified number of records using random data for the fields in the schema.

property.name: record-writer
property.description: Specifies the Controller Service to use for writing out the records

property.name: number-of-records
property.description: Specifies how many records will be generated for each outgoing FlowFile.

property.name: nullable-fields
property.description: Whether the generated fields will be nullable. Note that this property is ignored if Schema Text is set. Also it only affects the schema of the generated data, not whether any values will be null. If this property is true, see 'Null Value Percentage' to set the probability that any generated field will be null.

property.name: null-percentage
property.description: The percent probability (0-100%) that a generated value for any nullable field will be null. Set this property to zero to have no null values, or 100 to have all null values.

property.name: schema-text
property.description: The text of an Avro-formatted Schema used to generate record data. If this property is set, any user-defined properties are ignored.

dynamicProperty.name: Field name in generated record
dynamicProperty.value: Faker category for generated record values
dynamicProperty.description: Custom properties define the generated record schema using configured field names and value data types in absence of the Schema Text property

relationship.name: success
relationship.description: FlowFiles that are successfully created will be routed to this relationship

writesAttribute.name: mime.type
writesAttribute.description: Sets the mime.type attribute to the MIME Type specified by the Record Writer

writesAttribute.name: record.count
writesAttribute.description: The number of records in the FlowFile

extension.name: org.apache.nifi.processors.standard.GenerateTableFetch
extension.description:
Generates SQL select queries that fetch "pages" of rows from a table. The partition size property, along with the table's row count, determine the size and number of pages and generated FlowFiles. In addition, incremental fetching can be achieved by setting Maximum-Value Columns, which causes the processor to track the columns' maximum values, thus only fetching rows whose columns' values exceed the observed maximums. This processor is intended to be run on the Primary Node only.
This processor can accept incoming connections; the behavior of the processor is different whether incoming connections are provided: - If no incoming connection(s) are specified, the processor will generate SQL queries on the specified processor schedule. Expression Language is supported for many fields, but no FlowFile attributes are available. However the properties will be evaluated using the Environment/System properties. - If incoming connection(s) are specified and no FlowFile is available to a processor task, no work will be performed. - If incoming connection(s) are specified and a FlowFile is available to a processor task, the FlowFile's attributes may be used in Expression Language for such fields as Table Name and others. However, the Max-Value Columns and Columns to Return fields must be empty or refer to columns that are available in each specified table.

property.name: Database Connection Pooling Service
property.description: The Controller Service that is used to obtain a connection to the database.

property.name: db-fetch-db-type
property.description: The type/flavor of database, used for generating database-specific code. In many cases the Generic type should suffice, but some databases (such as Oracle) require custom SQL clauses.

allowableValue.description: Generates ANSI SQL
Generates Oracle compliant SQL
Generates Oracle compliant SQL for version 12 or greater
Generates MS SQL Compatible SQL, for version 2012 or greater
Generates MS SQL Compatible SQL for version 2008
Generates MySQL compatible SQL
Generates PostgreSQL compatible SQL
Generates Phoenix compliant SQL

property.name: Table Name
property.description: The name of the database table to be queried.

property.name: Columns to Return
property.description: A comma-separated list of column names to be used in the query. If your database requires special treatment of the names (quoting, e.g.), each name should include such treatment. If no column names are supplied, all columns in the specified table will be returned. NOTE: It is important to use consistent column names for a given table for incremental fetch to work properly.

property.name: Maximum-value Columns
property.description: A comma-separated list of column names. The processor will keep track of the maximum value for each column that has been returned since the processor started running. Using multiple columns implies an order to the column list, and each column's values are expected to increase more slowly than the previous columns' values. Thus, using multiple columns implies a hierarchical structure of columns, which is usually used for partitioning tables. This processor can be used to retrieve only those rows that have been added/updated since the last retrieval. Note that some JDBC types such as bit/boolean are not conducive to maintaining maximum value, so columns of these types should not be listed in this property, and will result in error(s) during processing. If no columns are provided, all rows from the table will be considered, which could have a performance impact. NOTE: It is important to use consistent max-value column names for a given table for incremental fetch to work properly.

property.name: Max Wait Time
property.description: The maximum amount of time allowed for a running SQL select query , zero means there is no limit. Max time less than 1 second will be equal to zero.

property.name: gen-table-fetch-partition-size
property.description: The number of result rows to be fetched by each generated SQL statement. The total number of rows in the table divided by the partition size gives the number of SQL statements (i.e. FlowFiles) generated. A value of zero indicates that a single FlowFile is to be generated whose SQL statement will fetch all rows in the table.

property.name: gen-table-column-for-val-partitioning
property.description: The name of a column whose values will be used for partitioning. The default behavior is to use row numbers on the result set for partitioning into 'pages' to be fetched from the database, using an offset/limit strategy. However for certain databases, it can be more efficient under the right circumstances to use the column values themselves to define the 'pages'. This property should only be used when the default queries are not performing well, when there is no maximum-value column or a single maximum-value column whose type can be coerced to a long integer (i.e. not date or timestamp), and the column values are evenly distributed and not sparse, for best performance.

property.name: db-fetch-where-clause
property.description: A custom clause to be added in the WHERE condition when building SQL queries.

property.name: gen-table-custom-orderby-column
property.description: The name of a column to be used for ordering the results if Max-Value Columns are not provided and partitioning is enabled. This property is ignored if either Max-Value Columns is set or Partition Size = 0. NOTE: If neither Max-Value Columns nor Custom ORDER BY Column is set, then depending on the the database/driver, the processor may report an error and/or the generated SQL may result in missing and/or duplicate rows. This is because without an explicit ordering, fetching each partition is done using an arbitrary ordering.

property.name: gen-table-output-flowfile-on-zero-results
property.displayName: Output Empty FlowFile on Zero Results
property.description: Depending on the specified properties, an execution of this processor may not result in any SQL statements generated. When this property is true, an empty FlowFile will be generated (having the parent of the incoming FlowFile if present) and transferred to the 'success' relationship. When this property is false, no output FlowFiles will be generated.

dynamicProperty.name: initial.maxvalue.<max_value_column>
dynamicProperty.value: Initial maximum value for the specified column
dynamicProperty.description: Specifies an initial max value for max value columns. Properties should be added in the format `initial.maxvalue.<max_value_column>`. This value is only used the first time the table is accessed (when a Maximum Value Column is specified). In the case of incoming connections, the value is only used the first time for each table specified in the FlowFiles.

relationship.name: success
relationship.description: Successfully created FlowFile from SQL query result set.

relationship.name: failure
relationship.description: This relationship is only used when SQL query execution (using an incoming FlowFile) failed. The incoming FlowFile will be penalized and routed to this relationship. If no incoming connection(s) are specified, this relationship is unused.

writesAttribute.name: generatetablefetch.sql.error
writesAttribute.description: If the processor has incoming connections, and processing an incoming FlowFile causes a SQL Exception, the FlowFile is routed to failure and this attribute is set to the exception message.

writesAttribute.name: generatetablefetch.tableName
writesAttribute.description: The name of the database table to be queried.

writesAttribute.name: generatetablefetch.columnNames
writesAttribute.description: The comma-separated list of column names used in the query.

writesAttribute.name: generatetablefetch.whereClause
writesAttribute.description: Where clause used in the query to get the expected rows.

writesAttribute.name: generatetablefetch.maxColumnNames
writesAttribute.description: The comma-separated list of column names used to keep track of data that has been returned since the processor started running.

writesAttribute.name: generatetablefetch.limit
writesAttribute.description: The number of result rows to be fetched by the SQL statement.

writesAttribute.name: generatetablefetch.offset
writesAttribute.description: Offset to be used to retrieve the corresponding partition.

writesAttribute.name: fragment.identifier
writesAttribute.description: All FlowFiles generated from the same query result set will have the same value for the fragment.identifier attribute. This can then be used to correlate the results.

writesAttribute.name: fragment.count
writesAttribute.description: This is the total number of FlowFiles produced by a single ResultSet. This can be used in conjunction with the fragment.identifier attribute in order to know how many FlowFiles belonged to the same incoming ResultSet.

writesAttribute.name: fragment.index
writesAttribute.description: This is the position of this FlowFile in the list of outgoing FlowFiles that were all generated from the same execution. This can be used in conjunction with the fragment.identifier attribute to know which FlowFiles originated from the same execution and in what order FlowFiles were produced

stateful.description: After performing a query on the specified table, the maximum values for the specified column(s) will be retained for use in future executions of the query. This allows the Processor to fetch only those records that have max values greater than the retained values. This can be used for incremental fetching, fetching of newly added rows, etc. To clear the maximum values, clear the state of the processor per the State Management documentation

extension.name: org.apache.nifi.processors.standard.GetFTP
extension.description: Fetches files from an FTP Server and creates FlowFiles from them

property.name: Hostname
property.description: The fully qualified hostname or IP address of the remote system

property.name: Port
property.description: The port that the remote system is listening on for file transfers

property.name: Username
property.description: Username

property.name: Password
property.description: Password for the user account

property.name: Connection Mode
property.description: The FTP Connection Mode

property.name: Transfer Mode
property.description: The FTP Transfer Mode

property.name: Remote Path
property.description: The path on the remote system from which to pull or push files

property.name: File Filter Regex
property.description: Provides a Java Regular Expression for filtering Filenames; if a filter is supplied, only files whose names match that Regular Expression will be fetched

property.name: Path Filter Regex
property.description: When Search Recursively is true, then only subdirectories whose path matches the given Regular Expression will be scanned

property.name: Polling Interval
property.description: Determines how long to wait between fetching the listing for new files

property.name: Search Recursively
property.description: If true, will pull files from arbitrarily nested subdirectories; otherwise, will not traverse subdirectories

property.name: follow-symlink
property.description: If true, will pull even symbolic files and also nested symbolic subdirectories; otherwise, will not read symbolic files and will not traverse symbolic link subdirectories

property.name: Ignore Dotted Files
property.description: If true, files whose names begin with a dot (".") will be ignored

property.name: Delete Original
property.description: Determines whether or not the file is deleted from the remote system after it has been successfully transferred

property.name: Connection Timeout
property.description: Amount of time to wait before timing out while creating a connection

property.name: Data Timeout
property.description: When transferring a file between the local and remote system, this value specifies how long is allowed to elapse without any data being transferred between systems

property.name: Max Selects
property.description: The maximum number of files to pull in a single connection

property.name: Remote Poll Batch Size
property.description: The value specifies how many file paths to find in a given directory on the remote system when doing a file listing. This value in general should not need to be modified but when polling against a remote system with a tremendous number of files this value can be critical. Setting this value too high can result very poor performance and setting it too low can cause the flow to be slower than normal.

property.name: Use Natural Ordering
property.description: If true, will pull files in the order in which they are naturally listed; otherwise, the order in which the files will be pulled is not defined

property.name: proxy-configuration-service
property.description: Specifies the Proxy Configuration Controller Service to proxy network requests. If set, it supersedes proxy settings configured per component. Supported proxies: HTTP + AuthN, SOCKS + AuthN

property.name: Proxy Type
property.description: Proxy type used for file transfers

property.name: Proxy Host
property.description: The fully qualified hostname or IP address of the proxy server

property.name: Proxy Port
property.description: The port of the proxy server

property.name: Http Proxy Username
property.description: Http Proxy Username

property.name: Http Proxy Password
property.description: Http Proxy Password

property.name: Internal Buffer Size
property.description: Set the internal buffer size for buffered data streams

property.name: ftp-use-utf8
property.description: Tells the client to use UTF-8 encoding when processing files and filenames. If set to true, the server must also support UTF-8 encoding.

relationship.name: success
relationship.description: All FlowFiles that are received are routed to success

writesAttribute.name: filename
writesAttribute.description: The filename is set to the name of the file on the remote server

writesAttribute.name: path
writesAttribute.description: The path is set to the path of the file's directory on the remote server. For example, if the <Remote Path> property is set to /tmp, files picked up from /tmp will have the path attribute set to /tmp. If the <Search Recursively> property is set to true and a file is picked up from /tmp/abc/1/2/3, then the path attribute will be set to /tmp/abc/1/2/3

writesAttribute.name: file.lastModifiedTime
writesAttribute.description: The date and time that the source file was last modified

writesAttribute.name: file.lastAccessTime
writesAttribute.description: The date and time that the file was last accessed. May not work on all file systems

writesAttribute.name: file.owner
writesAttribute.description: The numeric owner id of the source file

writesAttribute.name: file.group
writesAttribute.description: The numeric group id of the source file

writesAttribute.name: file.permissions
writesAttribute.description: The read/write/execute permissions of the source file

writesAttribute.name: absolute.path
writesAttribute.description: The full/absolute path from where a file was picked up. The current 'path' attribute is still populated, but may be a relative path

extension.name: org.apache.nifi.processors.standard.GetFile
extension.description: Creates FlowFiles from files in a directory. NiFi will ignore files it doesn't have at least read permissions for.

property.name: Input Directory
property.description: The input directory from which to pull files

property.name: File Filter
property.description: Only files whose names match the given regular expression will be picked up

property.name: Path Filter
property.description: When Recurse Subdirectories is true, then only subdirectories whose path matches the given regular expression will be scanned

property.name: Batch Size
property.description: The maximum number of files to pull in each iteration

property.name: Keep Source File
property.description: If true, the file is not deleted after it has been copied to the Content Repository; this causes the file to be picked up continually and is useful for testing purposes. If not keeping original NiFi will need write permissions on the directory it is pulling from otherwise it will ignore the file.

property.name: Recurse Subdirectories
property.description: Indicates whether or not to pull files from subdirectories

property.name: Polling Interval
property.description: Indicates how long to wait before performing a directory listing

property.name: Ignore Hidden Files
property.description: Indicates whether or not hidden files should be ignored

property.name: Minimum File Age
property.description: The minimum age that a file must be in order to be pulled; any file younger than this amount of time (according to last modification date) will be ignored

property.name: Maximum File Age
property.description: The maximum age that a file must be in order to be pulled; any file older than this amount of time (according to last modification date) will be ignored

property.name: Minimum File Size
property.description: The minimum size that a file must be in order to be pulled

property.name: Maximum File Size
property.description: The maximum size that a file can be in order to be pulled

relationship.name: success
relationship.description: All files are routed to success

writesAttribute.name: filename
writesAttribute.description: The filename is set to the name of the file on disk

writesAttribute.name: path
writesAttribute.description: The path is set to the relative path of the file's directory on disk. For example, if the <Input Directory> property is set to /tmp, files picked up from /tmp will have the path attribute set to ./. If the <Recurse Subdirectories> property is set to true and a file is picked up from /tmp/abc/1/2/3, then the path attribute will be set to abc/1/2/3

writesAttribute.name: file.creationTime
writesAttribute.description: The date and time that the file was created. May not work on all file systems

writesAttribute.name: file.lastModifiedTime
writesAttribute.description: The date and time that the file was last modified. May not work on all file systems

writesAttribute.name: file.lastAccessTime
writesAttribute.description: The date and time that the file was last accessed. May not work on all file systems

writesAttribute.name: file.owner
writesAttribute.description: The owner of the file. May not work on all file systems

writesAttribute.name: file.group
writesAttribute.description: The group owner of the file. May not work on all file systems

writesAttribute.name: file.permissions
writesAttribute.description: The read/write/execute permissions of the file. May not work on all file systems

writesAttribute.name: absolute.path
writesAttribute.description: The full/absolute path from where a file was picked up. The current 'path' attribute is still populated, but may be a relative path

restriction.explanation: Provides operator the ability to read from any file that NiFi has access to.
Provides operator the ability to delete any file that NiFi has access to.

extension.name: org.apache.nifi.processors.standard.GetSFTP
extension.description: Fetches files from an SFTP Server and creates FlowFiles from them

property.name: Hostname
property.description: The fully qualified hostname or IP address of the remote system

property.name: Port
property.description: The port that the remote system is listening on for file transfers

property.name: Username
property.description: Username

property.name: Password
property.description: Password for the user account

property.name: Private Key Path
property.description: The fully qualified path to the Private Key file

property.name: Private Key Passphrase
property.description: Password for the private key

property.name: Remote Path
property.description: The path on the remote system from which to pull or push files

property.name: File Filter Regex
property.description: Provides a Java Regular Expression for filtering Filenames; if a filter is supplied, only files whose names match that Regular Expression will be fetched

property.name: Path Filter Regex
property.description: When Search Recursively is true, then only subdirectories whose path matches the given Regular Expression will be scanned

property.name: Polling Interval
property.description: Determines how long to wait between fetching the listing for new files

property.name: Search Recursively
property.description: If true, will pull files from arbitrarily nested subdirectories; otherwise, will not traverse subdirectories

property.name: follow-symlink
property.description: If true, will pull even symbolic files and also nested symbolic subdirectories; otherwise, will not read symbolic files and will not traverse symbolic link subdirectories

property.name: Ignore Dotted Files
property.description: If true, files whose names begin with a dot (".") will be ignored

property.name: Delete Original
property.description: Determines whether or not the file is deleted from the remote system after it has been successfully transferred

property.name: Connection Timeout
property.description: Amount of time to wait before timing out while creating a connection

property.name: Data Timeout
property.description: When transferring a file between the local and remote system, this value specifies how long is allowed to elapse without any data being transferred between systems

property.name: Host Key File
property.description: If supplied, the given file will be used as the Host Key; otherwise, if 'Strict Host Key Checking' property is applied (set to true) then uses the 'known_hosts' and 'known_hosts2' files from ~/.ssh directory else no host key file will be used

property.name: Max Selects
property.description: The maximum number of files to pull in a single connection

property.name: Remote Poll Batch Size
property.description: The value specifies how many file paths to find in a given directory on the remote system when doing a file listing. This value in general should not need to be modified but when polling against a remote system with a tremendous number of files this value can be critical. Setting this value too high can result very poor performance and setting it too low can cause the flow to be slower than normal.

property.name: Strict Host Key Checking
property.description: Indicates whether or not strict enforcement of hosts keys should be applied

property.name: Send Keep Alive On Timeout
property.description: Send a Keep Alive message every 5 seconds up to 5 times for an overall timeout of 25 seconds.

property.name: Use Compression
property.description: Indicates whether or not ZLIB compression should be used when transferring files

property.name: Use Natural Ordering
property.description: If true, will pull files in the order in which they are naturally listed; otherwise, the order in which the files will be pulled is not defined

property.name: proxy-configuration-service
property.description: Specifies the Proxy Configuration Controller Service to proxy network requests. If set, it supersedes proxy settings configured per component. Supported proxies: HTTP + AuthN, SOCKS + AuthN

property.name: Proxy Type
property.description: Proxy type used for file transfers

property.name: Proxy Host
property.description: The fully qualified hostname or IP address of the proxy server

property.name: Proxy Port
property.description: The port of the proxy server

property.name: Http Proxy Username
property.description: Http Proxy Username

property.name: Http Proxy Password
property.description: Http Proxy Password

property.name: Ciphers Allowed
property.description: A comma-separated list of Ciphers allowed for SFTP connections. Leave unset to allow all. Available options are: 3des-cbc, 3des-ctr, aes128-cbc, aes128-ctr, aes128-gcm@openssh.com, aes192-cbc, aes192-ctr, aes256-cbc, aes256-ctr, aes256-gcm@openssh.com, arcfour, arcfour128, arcfour256, blowfish-cbc, blowfish-ctr, cast128-cbc, cast128-ctr, chacha20-poly1305@openssh.com, idea-cbc, idea-ctr, serpent128-cbc, serpent128-ctr, serpent192-cbc, serpent192-ctr, serpent256-cbc, serpent256-ctr, twofish-cbc, twofish128-cbc, twofish128-ctr, twofish192-cbc, twofish192-ctr, twofish256-cbc, twofish256-ctr

property.name: Key Algorithms Allowed
property.description: A comma-separated list of Key Algorithms allowed for SFTP connections. Leave unset to allow all. Available options are: ecdsa-sha2-nistp256, ecdsa-sha2-nistp256-cert-v01@openssh.com, ecdsa-sha2-nistp384, ecdsa-sha2-nistp384-cert-v01@openssh.com, ecdsa-sha2-nistp521, ecdsa-sha2-nistp521-cert-v01@openssh.com, rsa-sha2-256, rsa-sha2-512, ssh-dss, ssh-dss-cert-v01@openssh.com, ssh-ed25519, ssh-ed25519-cert-v01@openssh.com, ssh-rsa, ssh-rsa-cert-v01@openssh.com

property.name: Key Exchange Algorithms Allowed
property.description: A comma-separated list of Key Exchange Algorithms allowed for SFTP connections. Leave unset to allow all. Available options are: curve25519-sha256, curve25519-sha256@libssh.org, diffie-hellman-group-exchange-sha1, diffie-hellman-group-exchange-sha256, diffie-hellman-group1-sha1, diffie-hellman-group14-sha1, diffie-hellman-group14-sha256, diffie-hellman-group14-sha256@ssh.com, diffie-hellman-group15-sha256, diffie-hellman-group15-sha256@ssh.com, diffie-hellman-group15-sha384@ssh.com, diffie-hellman-group15-sha512, diffie-hellman-group16-sha256, diffie-hellman-group16-sha384@ssh.com, diffie-hellman-group16-sha512, diffie-hellman-group16-sha512@ssh.com, diffie-hellman-group17-sha512, diffie-hellman-group18-sha512, diffie-hellman-group18-sha512@ssh.com, ecdh-sha2-nistp256, ecdh-sha2-nistp384, ecdh-sha2-nistp521, ext-info-c

property.name: Message Authentication Codes Allowed
property.description: A comma-separated list of Message Authentication Codes allowed for SFTP connections. Leave unset to allow all. Available options are: hmac-md5, hmac-md5-96, hmac-md5-96-etm@openssh.com, hmac-md5-etm@openssh.com, hmac-ripemd160, hmac-ripemd160-96, hmac-ripemd160-etm@openssh.com, hmac-ripemd160@openssh.com, hmac-sha1, hmac-sha1-96, hmac-sha1-96@openssh.com, hmac-sha1-etm@openssh.com, hmac-sha2-256, hmac-sha2-256-etm@openssh.com, hmac-sha2-512, hmac-sha2-512-etm@openssh.com

relationship.name: success
relationship.description: All FlowFiles that are received are routed to success
